Articles.Content:
* Forget space!

* Never be troubled by transonic drag!

* Relive the good old days of underpowered jet aircraft!

With the semi-scale Gloster Meteor:

Special features include:

No Gimballing or reaction wheels - It's all down to control surfaces!

Massive asymmetric thrust if one engine flames out thanks to authentic poor design!

Guaranteed obsolete within 6 years! (no refunds given)

Extra special features:

Even more nerfed stock engines to give that "only just enough power" thrill!

Unuseable fuel included as trimming ballast, just to torment the pilot on long flights!

Download this almost-authentic slice of retro British technology from: http://s000.tinyupload.com/index.php?file_id=09211218576017062794
Looks great, I'm going to give it a try myself later.

Thanks Percy! It'll join the ranks of my Science aircraft! I might try and make a P-80 and Me-262 just to round out the early jet thing and maybe the Mig-9. I run KAX so I have a few propeller aircraft to start flight testing and such. (It's a little unrealistic right now.... The D-25 is.... Entirely too overpowered.... As in I can approach the sound barrier... In level flight at around 3kft. That said, I know people are working on that.

Downloaded both sets of files!
